originalText.text: I was married at this church, and it was the Rev. who made us feel welcomed.  It was not just his personality, it was his conviction and belief in the BIBLE and God.  We, my husband and I, love this church, because we believe and feel that they are grounded in teaching the truth. The assistant pastor Dennis, our Deacon Timothy,  our Musical Director Bernadette, all contribute to make our church experience profoundly spiritually nourishing each week.  Bible study is such a source of strength and encouragement as well.  PLEASE visit us, tea and are served post serviceüôèüèæ‚ù§Ô∏è

originalText.text:
This is a great church, one where everyone is welcome and there are no strangers. It's a relatively small congregation, but everyone looks out for one another and works seamlessly together. It's a traditional kind of church, the Episcopal church of years gone by with all its formality. And yet, there is something fresh and different about this church. You can feel the genuineness of the people, the rectors, and the church when you walk in the doors. The music is fantastic, and you'll be surprised how Bernadette Hoke, the Music Director, can make a choir of five sound so complete and beautiful.

I particularly enjoy the sermons from Rev. Matt Harrington, who employs the congregation to read the Bible exactly as it was written, no need for interpretations. He has his finger on the pulse of this congregation, knows each member well and their individual circumstances.  He has the unique ability to pull the whole group together with his upbeat personality, welcoming sense, and his dry wit. That said, he's very much that "old school" minister, the kind of minister we all wish we still had. That's him, day in and day out. Communion is beautiful and just feels right.  Weekly Bible Study is conducted by Dr. Dennis Wermert, which always challenges us to broaden our views while confirming our beliefs as solid Christians. Dr. Wermert and Tim Meadows occasionally alternate in preaching the sermons when Rev. Harrington is off visiting other churches in the Diocese. Equally interesting sermons, very uplifting.

originalText.text: Matt and Dennis, the two rectors, are great guys, very kindhearted. If you're looking for a church in New York City that actually teaches the Bible and doesn't follow every theological fad that comes along, you will love this church. The congregation are fine people as well, with a core group of steady attenders. Do you miss the old Episcopal Church? welcome home!

originalText.text: I joined this church after being disappointed in other churches, and have found where I want to remain. Rector Matthew preaches the Word of God and all the staff is friendly. Also it's not a huge congregation so you can get to know people.

text.text: I joined this church after being disappointed in other churches, and have found where I want to remain. Rector Matthew preaches the Word of God and all the staff is friendly. Also it's not a huge congregation so you can get to know people.

originalText.text: Don't waste your time.  The Rector, Dr. Harrington is a self-absorbed egocentric phony Christian, who probably doesn't even believe in God and just goes through the motions.  Like most people within the Reformed Episcopal Church who are phonies themselves and run a mickey mouse seminary.
